DAVy is a modern CalDAV, CardDAV, and WebCal synchronization app for Android. Keep your calendars, contacts, and tasks in sync across all your devices.
DAVy is open source software licensed under Apache 2.0

DAVy is a privacy-focused CalDAV/CardDAV/WebCal sync client for Android that synchronizes calendars, contacts, and read-only calendar subscriptions with your server. All data stays local - no cloud services or tracking.

DAVy works with any CalDAV/CardDAV compliant server including Nextcloud, ownCloud, Radicale, Baïkal, Fastmail, iCloud, and more. It also supports WebCal (webcal://) subscriptions for read-only calendar feeds.
Why is my sync not working?

Check these common issues:

• Server URL is correct (including https://)
• Username and password are valid
• Calendar/address book sync is enabled (toggle switches)
• WiFi-only sync is disabled or WiFi is connected
• Battery optimization is disabled for DAVy
• App has calendar and contacts permissions

Auto-sync is controlled by DAVy's settings - Android system settings are not required.

1. Open account details by tapping an account

2. Ensure calendars/address books have sync enabled (toggle switches)

3. Disable battery optimization when prompted (critical for reliable background sync)

4. Optionally configure sync interval in account settings menu
Yes! You can add and sync multiple CalDAV/CardDAV accounts simultaneously. Each account can have different sync settings, intervals, and WiFi-only preferences.

Calendar events appear in Android\'s Calendar app. Contacts appear in Android\'s Contacts app. DAVy handles the sync behind the scenes, while your default apps display the data.\n\nIf events don\'t appear: Open your Calendar app → Settings → Make sure the DAVy account is enabled/visible.
How do I delete an account or collections?

Account deletion:
• Long-press the account card on main screen
• Scroll to bottom of details page
• Tap "Delete Account" button

Single item deletion:
• Tap once on calendar/address book/WebCal
• Scroll to bottom of details page
• Tap "Delete" button

Multiple items deletion:
• Long-press any calendar/address book/WebCal to enter batch mode
• Select multiple items
• Tap the 3-dot menu (top right) → Delete

Deleting an account removes all associated data.
Enable this in account settings to only sync when connected to WiFi, saving mobile data. Useful for large calendars or limited data plans.
What happens if I rename an account?
Renaming an account can cause it to become disabled in the Android Calendar app because Android uses the account name as an identifier. You can re-enable the account in your Calendar app settings.

WebCal subscriptions are read-only calendar feeds (webcal:// URLs) that DAVy periodically fetches and syncs to your device. Perfect for public calendars, sports schedules, holidays, etc. Find them in the WebCal tab of account details.

• Calendar: Read/write to sync events with your device

• Contacts: Read/write to sync contacts with your device

• Notifications (Android 13+): Show sync status and errors

DAVy only accesses data necessary for sync - no tracking or analytics.

Android\'s battery optimization can prevent background sync. Disabling it ensures DAVy can sync reliably on schedule.\n\nYou\'ll be prompted to disable it in account settings. DAVy is designed for minimal battery usage.

Long-press any calendar, address book, or WebCal subscription to enter batch selection mode. Select multiple items, then use the delete button in the menu to remove them all at once. Tap outside or use back gesture to exit batch mode.

DAVy (\"the App\") is a CalDAV, CardDAV, and WebCal synchronization application for Android. This Privacy Policy explains what information the App collects, how it is used, and your rights regarding your data.\n\nWe are committed to protecting your privacy. DAVy is designed to sync your calendar, contact, and task data with your own servers — we do not collect, store, or transmit any of your personal data to our servers.

DAVy collects and stores the following information locally on your device:

• Server credentials (URL, username, password/OAuth tokens)
• Calendar events, contacts, and tasks from your servers
• App preferences and settings
• Sync status and error logs

This data is stored securely on your device and transmitted only to the servers you configure.

The information collected is used solely for:

• Authenticating with your CalDAV/CardDAV/WebCal servers
• Synchronizing calendars, contacts, and tasks
• Storing your preferences
• Displaying sync status and troubleshooting errors

• All data is stored locally on your Android device
• Passwords are encrypted using Android's secure storage
• Data is transmitted over HTTPS when your servers support it
• No data is sent to DAVy developers or third parties
DAVy does not share your data with any third parties. Your data is only transmitted to the servers you explicitly configure.

You have full control over your data:

• Delete accounts and their associated data at any time
• Export your data via backup features
• Clear all app data through Android settings
• Revoke permissions at any time

DAVy requests the following permissions:

• Calendar: Read/write to sync calendar events
• Contacts: Read/write to sync contacts
• Internet: Connect to your CalDAV/CardDAV servers
• Notifications: Show sync status and errors
DAVy does not include any third-party analytics, advertising, or tracking services. The App communicates only with servers you configure.
DAVy does not knowingly collect information from children under 13. The App is intended for general audiences and does not target children.
For questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us through the app\'s support channels or GitHub repository.
